markdown:
Ghalzarokh demons, also known as tyranny demons, form from the souls of cruel autocrats. These demons subjugate weaker fiends. After amassing an army, a ghalzarokh begins a chaotic spree of bloody conquest. **[Recall Knowledge - Fiend](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)** ([Religion](/Skills.aspx?ID=13)): DC 36 **[Unspecific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 34 **[Specific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 31 [Ghalzarokh](/Monsters.aspx?ID=2523) **Source** [Pathfinder #191: The Destiny War](/Sources.aspx?ID=199) pg. 80 **Perception** +28; [darkvision](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=12), [scent](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=33) (imprecise) 60 feet, [_see invisibility_](/Spells.aspx?ID=271) **Languages** [Abyssal](/Languages.aspx?ID=12), [Celestial](/Languages.aspx?ID=16), [Draconic](/Languages.aspx?ID=2); [telepathy](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=37) 100 feet **Skills** [Acrobatics](/Skills.aspx?ID=1) +26, [Athletics](/Skills.aspx?ID=3) +27, [Intimidation](/Skills.aspx?ID=7) +30, [Religion](/Skills.aspx?ID=13) +28, [Stealth](/Skills.aspx?ID=15) +24 **Str** +6 **Dex** +3 **Con** +6 **Int** +4 **Wis** +5 **Cha** +7 --- **AC** 36 **Fort** +29 **Ref** +24 **Will** +26 +1 status to all saves vs. [magic](/Traits.aspx?ID=103) **HP** 330 **Weaknesses** [cold iron](/Equipment.aspx?ID=375) 15, good 15 **Defiance Vulnerability** Defiance causes a ghalzarokh anguish. If a creature scores a critical success on a saving throw to resist the ghalzarokh's [_charm_](/Spells.aspx?ID=34), [_command_](/Spells.aspx?ID=45), [_dominate_](/Spells.aspx?ID=87), or [_suggestion_](/Spells.aspx?ID=315) spells or Project Blame, the demon takes 4d6 mental damage. The demon takes the same damage if it rolls a critical failure on an [Intimidation](/Skills.aspx?ID=7) check.
**Project Blame** ([divine](/Traits.aspx?ID=48), [emotion](/Traits.aspx?ID=60), [enchantment](/Traits.aspx?ID=61), [mental](/Traits.aspx?ID=106)) **Trigger** A creature succeeds or critically succeeds at a saving throw against one of the ghalzarokh's spells or Abyssal Spew, or the ghalzarokh misses a creature with a melee Strike; **Effect** The creature must attempt a DC 36 Will saving throw.
**Critical Success** The creature is temporarily immune to Project Blame for 24 hours, and the ghalzarokh suffers from its defiance vulnerability.
**Success** The creature's [stupefied](/Conditions.aspx?ID=37) condition increases by 1 (if they succeeded on a saving throw) or its [clumsy](/Conditions.aspx?ID=3) condition increases by 1 (if the demon missed them with a Strike). This increase in value lasts until the end of the creature's next turn but can't increase either condition beyond a value of 3.
**Failure** As success, but the duration changes to 1 minute. A creature can attempt a DC 36 Will save at the end of its turn to remove the effect early.
**Critical Failure** As failure, but for 24 hours. --- **Speed** 25 feet, fly 40 feet **Melee** jaws +30 ([Evil](/Traits.aspx?ID=64), [Magical](/Traits.aspx?ID=103), [reach 10 feet](/Traits.aspx?ID=192)), **Damage** 3d12+14 piercing plus 1d6 evil **Melee** claw +30 ([Agile](/Traits.aspx?ID=170), [Evil](/Traits.aspx?ID=64), [Magical](/Traits.aspx?ID=103), [reach 10 feet](/Traits.aspx?ID=192)), **Damage** 3d8+14 slashing plus 1d6 evil **Divine Innate Spells** DC 36 - **4th** [Charm](/Spells.aspx?ID=34) (at will) - **5th** [Command](/Spells.aspx?ID=45) (at will) - **6th** [Dominate](/Spells.aspx?ID=87) - **8th** [Fireball](/Spells.aspx?ID=119), [Suggestion](/Spells.aspx?ID=315) - **Constant (8th)** [See Invisibility](/Spells.aspx?ID=271) **Rituals** DC 36 - **1st** [Abyssal Pact](/Rituals.aspx?ID=21) **Abyssal Spew** ([Acid](/Traits.aspx?ID=3), [Divine](/Traits.aspx?ID=48), [Evocation](/Traits.aspx?ID=65), [Fire](/Traits.aspx?ID=72)) The ghalzarokh spews corrosive flame that deals 8d6 acid damage and 8d6 fire damage in a 40-foot cone (DC 36 [basic](/Rules.aspx?ID=329) Reflex save). The ghalzarokh can't use Abyssal Spew again for 1d4 rounds. **[Rend](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=30)** claw
Demon Thralls Ghalzarokhs are bullies who prefer numerous thralls to allies. These demons loathe owing any other being a favor and serve stronger creatures only with the expectation of rich reward. A ghalzarokh can rarely be found without a fiendish entourage or army (such as a demon throng). They prefer “pacts” with “lesser” demons, usually offering only a feeble guarantee to allow the weaker fiend's continued existence.
name: Ghalzarokh
